worklogs.comment:
xuechendi commented on pull request #5522: ARROW-6720:[JAVA][C++]Support Parquet Read and Write in Java
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5522
 
 
   Added a new java interface to support parquet read and write from hdfs or local file.
   
   The purpose of this implementation is that when we loading and dumping parquet data in Java, we can only use rowBased put and get methods. Since arrow already has C++ implementation to load and dump parquet, so we wrapped those codes as Java APIs.
   
   After test, we noticed in our workload, performance improved more than 2x comparing with rowBased load and dump. So we want to contribute codes to arrow.
   
   This is a total independent change:
   c++ codes are under cpp/jni/parquet, used as jni bridge.
   java codes are under java/adapter/parquet, ParquetReader and ParquetWriter is the main interface class. Java UnitTest is also included.
   
   Signed-off-by: Chendi Xue <chendi.xue@intel.com>
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5522#issuecomment-535966601
 
 
   > Another high level comment is this seems to duplicate a lot of code from ORC adapter (the thread-safe map popped out as one example). Is it share common implementations?
   
   @emkornfield, yes, currentmap was copied from orc, so as some codes in java side, the reason I did as that way is that I was thinking to limit my modification to existing codes, so I copied it to parquet folder.
   Better way is to make the duplicated part as a common lib, but I am thinking will it be ok if I open another PR or commit for the codes refine?

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

fields.description:
We added a new java interface to support parquet read and write from hdfs or local file.

The purpose of this implementation is that when we loading and dumping parquet data in Java, we can only use rowBased put and get methods. Since arrow already has C++ implementation to load and dump parquet, so we wrapped those codes as Java APIs.

After test, we noticed in our workload, performance improved more than 2x comparing with rowBased load and dump. So we want to contribute codes to arrow.

since this is a total independent change, there is no codes change to current arrow codes. We added two folders as listed:  java/adapter/parquet and cpp/src/jni/parquet
fields.summary: [JAVA][C++]Support Parquet Read and Write in Java

comments.body: I don't think this has been fully resolved, we should probably make subtasks to record the progress towards getting this all checked in.
Where do things stand on this project?
I moved out of 1.0.0 due to lack of activity
It would be nice to have a status update here. Until that I'm postponing to 3.0.

I think that this proposed feature interacts with
 * ARROW-7272
 * ARROW-7808

Once we have the ability to view the same Arrow buffers as a RecordBatch/Table across both Java and cpp, we just need to provide Java methods that invoke the Parquet reader and writer functionality in cpp.
Added issue links for Java Dataset read API and write API.

This issue was last updated over 90 days ago, which may be an indication it is no longer being actively worked. To better reflect the current state, the issue is being unassigned. Please feel free to re-take assignment of the issue if it is being actively worked, or if you plan to start that work soon.
